Professional Experience

Data Scientist

Vancovuer, CA
2015 to present

• NLP & Text Mining: Analyzed 200K+ documents (product description) and built a machine learning pipeline to score the relevance of customers’ search queries to the products. Using several NLP and text mining techniques combined with gradient boosted regression trees and ensembling, achieved a far better accuracy (60% improvement in RMSE toward the top benchmark, i.e. human rating of relevance) than standard techniques in text relevance—tf-idf algorithm for instance.
(Python Code, https://github.com/rmanak/search_relevance)

• Time Series Analysis, Forecasting & Consumer Behaviour: Analyzed sale history of 1K+ stores and built a regression model (GAM with local regression) combined with a boosted decision tree to predict sale across stores based on several factors including time trends, promotion, competition, etc. (Python & R Code, RMSE: ∼ 0.11)

• Predictive Analytics: Using a gradient boosting decision tree, ensembling methods and 260K+ customers’ previous data, built a classifier with ∼ 97% accuracy (ROC) to predict which customer will purchase the insurance quote from a noisy unstructured data (R Code)

Research and Development

Vancovuer, CA
2010 to 2015

• Conducting research in numerical relativity and computational physics

• Implementing advanced numerical algorithms, and developing scientific computing tools for simulations of strong gravity objects such as black holes and studying the nonlinear physics.

• Applying high-performance computing facilities to parallelize compute-intensive calculations and speed up the computation by factors of 100-1000x.

• Designing high-level programming language (FD Toolkit) to pose and solve complex sets of PDEs using finite difference techniques and to implement rapid workflows for developing the diagnostic facilities.

• Enhancing the computation efficiency using optimization algorithms such as adaptive mesh refinement, multigrid, and non-uniform grid distribution.

• Analyzing the scientific results using statistical data analysis methods and visualization tools.

• Collaborate in team projects, create reports and publish the scientific results in peer-reviewed journals, explain the complex aspects of the research work in several presentations.

CAP Associate / Teaching Assistant

Vancouver, CA
2009 to 2014

• Providing lectures and assistance with computational physics course. Performing system administration tasks for setting up the scientific computing environment for students.

• Designing exam problems and evaluating results for Canadian Association of Physics' national physics olympiad.

• Mentoring students in the final projects and improving their problem solving and programming skills.

Member of Scientific Committee

International Physics Olympiad, Isfahan, IR
2006 to 2007

• Collaborating with the scientific committee in designing the theoretical and experimental exam for the 38th International Physics Olympiad with more than 50 participating countries.

• Assisting the committee in assembling and operating the experimental exam.

• Demonstrating the experimental setup to the leaders of the teams and providing technical explanations in the functionality of the instrument and performing the measurements.
